timeline.message: Hotfix recruitment failing for equal amounts of items

timeline.bodyText: why not call the function hasWorkerOpenRequests for this part?
timeline.author: Raycoms

timeline.bodyText: This here is important, we should re-request if the pickup failed.
timeline.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText: shouldnt the normal AI handle that? Like if the request is completed and gets removed but it did not get the item it wanted, it naturally would run into re-requesting
replies.author: someaddons

replies.bodyText: Not necessarily very timely. I think it's a neat speed improvement to have it here without any backlash.
replies.author: Raycoms

timeline.bodyText: Potentially this should be more generic. Make it a set or a list, etc. So that this can be extended if needed.
timeline.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText: hm I wanted to avoid having to sort a complete list and compare it all again
replies.author: someaddons

replies.bodyText: could make it a map citizen id to Entity for quick access
replies.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText: I'm sorting them by distance here, don't think a map would help with that :D
replies.author: someaddons

replies.bodyText: That should be relatively simple. Make it an ordered list by distance such that you can always just poll the last one out each round. That would probably make even the existing one easier.
replies.author: Raycoms

timeline.bodyText: This means they can go stairs up and down though, right?
timeline.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText: ye stairs would work, you often got stairs as rooftop aswell so can't exclude those.
replies.author: someaddons

replies.bodyText: Maybe we should add something like "max 5y difference" or so. So they don't climb walls down if it has stairs.
replies.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText: ye gonna add that as destination condition
replies.author: someaddons

timeline.bodyText: There is already a horizontal directions array in vanilla you can query afaik
timeline.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText: hm only seeing a private one
replies.author: someaddons

timeline.bodyText: I don't see a problem going up, I think the problem is only going down imo
timeline.author: Raycoms

replies.bodyText: but some might want to station them not on the highest but inbetween somewhere
replies.author: someaddons

replies.bodyText: Let's say I did that. I'd be fine for them to go a bit up to hit the target, but not to go much further down (compared to the guarding position)
replies.author: Raycoms

timeline.message: Fix ranger not pickup up arrows, fix walking to building after eating/sickness etc unless there is an important other task
fix research config, fix 2. closest guard

timeline.author: Raycoms

timeline.message: Fix teleporting into wall, fix teleporting when not needed
save raid night counter, remove TH button

Merge remote-tracking branch 'remotes/origin/version/1.15' into betterGuards
